bike.data <- data %>%
  mutate(
    incl_rack = str_match(General.Location, "BIKE RACKS?"),
    date = lubridate::parse_date_time(Date.Reported, "%m/%d/%Y")
  ) %>%
  drop_na() 


bike.data %>%
  filter(Nature..Classification. == "Larceny-Theft") %>%
  mutate(
    when = ifelse(date >= parse_date_time("9/19/2021", "%m/%d/%Y"), "before", "after")
  ) %>%
  group_by(date, when) %>%
  summarise(count = n()) %>%
  ungroup() %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = date, y = count)) +
    geom_bar(aes(fill=when), stat="identity") +
    labs(x = "", y = "# of reported thefts", title="Bike thefts increase since move in weekend",
         caption="Source: UCPD Daily Crime Log") +
    scale_y_continuous(breaks=c(0, 4, 8), expand=c(0, 0.15)) +

    ) +
    scale_fill_manual(values=c(`after`="#d3d3d3", `before`="#4E79A7")) +
    theme_minimal() +
    theme(
      legend.position="none",

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(lubridate)

data <- read.csv("biketheftupdate.csv") %>%
  mutate(
    date = lubridate::parse_date_time(Date.Reported, "%m/%d/%Y")
  ) %>%
  select(date, crime=Crimes, location=Location)
```

```{r}
# Get start week date:
data <- data %>%
  mutate(
    start_date = lubridate::floor_date(date, unit="month")
  )
```

```{r}
# get data for start of school year

# make objects for each start date
d2018 <- date("2018-09-23")
d2019 <- date("2019-09-22")
d2020 <- date("2020-09-27")
d2021 <- date("2021-09-19")

# create vector to hold start datse
start.dates <- c(d2018, d2019, d2020, d2021)

# add column to data frame 
data <- data %>%
  mutate(
    start = start.dates[year(date) - 2018 + 1], 
    dist = interval(start, date) / days(1)
  ) 

# filter out values >= 0 and <= 30
data %>%
  filter(dist>=0 & dist<=30) %>% 
  group_by(year(start)) %>% 
  count()
  
# use dplyr to group by year -> count # of rows in each yr = # of thefts
  
```

```{r}
# Group data by the week:
grouped.week <- data %>%
  group_by(start_date) %>%
  summarise(n = n())

grouped.week %>%
  filter(month(start_date) %in% 8:10)

# make plot:
grouped.week %>%
  mutate(
    when = ifelse(start_date >= lubridate::parse_date_time("9/19/2021", "%m/%d/%Y"), "after", "before")
  ) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = start_date, y = n, fill = when)) +
    geom_bar(stat="identity")
```
